intro: Pleurostachys dusenii, commonly known as the Dusen's pleurostachys, is a rare and unique member of the Agavaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of western Mexico, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant is characterized by its rosette-forming structure with thick, fleshy leaves that are often blue-green in color. Its flowers are produced in a tall, branched inflorescence, and they are typically white or pale green. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
